item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7888) to reform the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 529) to extend the customs waters of the United States from 12 nautical miles to 24 nautical miles from the baselines of the United States, consistent with Presidential Proclamation 7219; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1112) denouncing the Biden administration's immigration policies; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1117) opposing efforts to place one-sided pressure on Israel with respect to Gaza.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: Extending Limits of U.S. Customs Waters Act
Denouncing the Biden administration's immigration policies.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act
Opposing efforts to place one-sided pressure on Israel with respect to Gaza.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 208 (Roll no. 113). (text: CR H2322)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 208 (Roll no. 113). (text: CR H2322)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 208 - 202 (Roll no. 112).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1137.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2321-2328)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 70.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-456, by Mr. Massie.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-456, by Mr. Massie.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 7888 under a structured rule and H.R. 529, H. Res. 1112, and H. Res. 1117 each under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 7888, H.R. 529, H. Res. 1112, and H. Res. 1117. Motion to recommit allowed on H.R. 7888 and H.R. 529.

Res. 1112) denouncing the Biden administration's immigration policies; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1117) opposing efforts to place one-sided pressure on Israel with respect to Gaza.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
